𒆟 GIR₁₁ cross 𓏴 𓏵 𓏶 𓐍 𓊖
𒆟 kirid ⋍ Kurt court cult 𒀀𒆟𒋾 sanctuary
𒆟 šìr šèr ⋍ Kerker 𒆟𒋾 crime, Schuld
𒆟 KESH ⋍ Ker
𒆟 KESH : cache 𒂦 baut
𒆟 kesh "bind" ≈ catch
𒆟 KESH <> 𒆟 caterva in 𒂟 Zug zukeš 𒅗𒆟 zu₂keš₂ kikosi@Swahili 𒅗𒆟𒁺 #kişru "troop" 𒆟 #kaşāru gather 𒅗𒆟 zu₂keš₂ᵃ "to gather" kešda kešed
𒆟 kešda : court ⇔ custom ritual gathering @ Kiste
𒆟 kešda : cache Kontor
𒆟 kešda ≈ 𒆟𒁺 #kişru 𒅗𒆟𒁺 zu₂keš₂ra₂ "troop" Zug #kişru guerre Truppenzug

ḫir šir₃ gir₁₁ •ñir

𒆟 •ĝir •g̃ir •ñir 𒂈 #nīru #nīri niri 𓈖 𓅱 𓎛 𓃒 yoke ≈ 𒂇 𒂆 𒆟 gir₁₁ girth ⇔ Gurt girder girdle cord *gʰerdʰ- “to encircle“
𒂡 šir₃ : 𒆟 Geschirr giscirri “trimmed” skeran “to shear” *(s)ker- “to cut” ƒ/2
𒂡 ḪIR ⇔ 𒆟 HIR harness < Heer herr “army” ⇔ guerre ƒ

𒋡 sila₃ < šir₃ 𒂡 in 𒄑𒆕𒋡 Geschirr 𒂡 ḪIR "harness"

KESH2 / keš2 (kešda) [853x] = to bind; gather; organize; assemble; compile

𒂡 ḫir ⇔ PIE *h₂er- “to join”

𒂡 šir₃ | squeeze | serra, serrare ⇔ serrō serrāre “to close”
𒂡 šir₃ | squeeze | szorít @Ugric *śorɜ “narrow” + -ít ⇔ sıxmaq սեղմել sełmel
𒂡 šir₃ | tighten | (zu)zerren serrer serrō “close, shut”
𒂡 šir₃ | tighten | ⇔ 𒆟 gir₁₁ to yoke, harness, bind

𒆟 gir₁₁ | yoke | ярмо́ jarmó ꙗрьмъ jarĭmŭ ⇔ 𒂡 ḫir PIE *h₂er- “to join”
𒆟 gir₁₁ | yoke | giugu jugu iugu ⰹⰳⱁ igo yoke Joch
𒆟 gir₁₁ | yoke | ngiug < jungir giúnghere giungiri xunguir junyir > uncir join unite
𒆟 gir₁₁ | yoke | •ngir •ñir 𒉌𒄿𒊑 ni-i-ri niri 𒉌𒄿𒊒 nīru ܢܺܝܪܳܐ nīrā نِير nīr 𓅘 𓎛 𓃀 𓏴 𓂡
𒆟 gir₁₁ | yoke | •ñir 𓈖 𓅱 𓎛 𓃀 𓅱 𓃒 | yoke-oxen | 𒉌𒄿𒊒 nīru-bull נִירָא nīrā 牛軛 牛轭 niú'è
𒆟 gir₁₁ | yoke | ⇔ angurten ngërthej “to tie, bind, fasten”
𒂡 ḫir ⇔ 𒆟 | yoke | አርዑት ʾärʿut
𒂡 ḫir ⇔ 𒆟 | yoke | أُرْعُوَّة ʾurʿuwwa
𒂡 ḫir ⇔ 𒆟 | yoke | 𐎓𐎍 ʿl vs zugón "yoke" ↔ Zügel vs *yugóm "yoke" Joch
